stx.concurrent.ActorFactory<T, S>

type
interface
defined in
stx.concurrent.Actor
Tries to coalesce the two elements into a single element

Instance Methods

create<X>(handler : X -> T -> stx.Tuple2<X, stx.Future<S>>, ?coalescer : Coalescer<T>) : Actor<T, S>

parameters
handler The message handler. This function will be passed the current state and the current message, and should return the next state and a future of the response.
coalescer An optional function to coalesce adjacent messages in the actor's queue.
Creates an actor using a function that will be called to handle every message the actor receives. The function should not enclose any variables and should maintain state exclusively through its parameter and return value.

createStateless(loop : T -> stx.Future<S>, ?coalescer : Coalescer<T>) : Actor<T, S>

Creates a stateless actor (an actor that requires no initial state, and does not produce any state.
